title: Ticket #4207: Giving multiple names to The Tool can lead to incorrect failures
description:
Ticket #3686 made changes to The Tool (a.k.a condor_on/off/...) to make it easier to identify daemons when their names aren't full DNS hostnames and when the names of the master and its child daemons are different.

This introduced a bug when specifying multiple names on the command line. The tool would report "Can't find address for <daemon type> <daemon name>" for some of the daemons, even though it received ads for those daemons from the collector. One way to trigger this is to include an invalid daemon name. Then, all subsequent daemons named on the command line will not be found.

The problem is that when the tool examines the daemon ads for ones that match a given name, it changed the Name attribute in all of the ads rather than in just the ads that match the given name.
